SCANDINAVIAN WELFARE STUDY [SCANDINAVIA 1972]: Supplemented with Treiman Prestige Scores.[Computer file] Copenhagen, Denmark: Danish Data Archives [distributor]; Los Angeles, CA: Institute for Social Science Research, University of California, Los Angeles. fields.value: Scandanavian Welfare Survey, 1972: Supplemented with Treiman Prestige Scores (M025V1)

datasetContactAffiliation.value: University of California, Los Angeles. Social Science Data Archive.

dsDescriptionValue.value:
The purpose of this study is the evaluate the level of welfare of the national populations of Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden. The survey addresses the difference between welfare and happiness, as well as the individuals' perceived level of living, and self-evaluated quality of life. Later, Donald Treiman, a Sociolo
gy Professor at UCLA, acquired the data and evaluated it based on his own Prestige scoring system. Note: the data and documentation are irregular and care should be taken in using the files.

topicClassValue.value: Occupational, Geographic, and Social Stratification and Mobility

fields.value:
Subject: STANDARD DEPOSIT TERMS 1.0  Type: DATAPASS:TERMS:STANDARD:1.0  Notes: The UCLA Social Science Data Archive (“the Archive”) gives permission and any required licenses to Data-PASS to make the Content available for archiving, preservation and access (with permission of the Archive), within the Data Preservation Alliance for the Social Sciences ("Data-PASS") in accordance with the Data-PASS terms (the "Terms") of use (available from: http://www.icpsr.org/Data-PASS). Including permission to: (a) redisseminate copies of the Data Collection in a variety of distribution formats only according to the standard terms of use of the Archive; (b) promote and advertise the Data Collection in any publicity (in any form) for Data-PASS and the Archive; (c) describe, catalog, validate and document the Content; (d) store, translate, copy or re-format the Data Collection in
any way to ensure its future preservation and accessibility, improve usability and/or protect respondent confidentiality; (e) incorporate metadata (cataloging information) or documentation regarding this study into public access catalogues. The Archive represents and warrants that the Content conforms to all Terms and that the Archive is lawfully entitled and has full authority to license Data-Pass to use the Materials in the ways described in the Terms.; Subject: Alternate title  Type: Title information  Notes: This study is also known as the Comparative Scandinavian Welfare Survey by Erik Allardt and Hannu UUsitalo; Subject: Alternate title  Type: Title information  Notes: This study is also known as The Scandinavian Survey of Welfare and Need-Satisfaction, March-May 1972, by Erik Allardt and Hannu Uusitalo.;
University of California. Los Angeles. Social Science Data Archive

Individuals between 15 to 64 years old, living in Denmark, Finland, Norway and Sweden.
